isaInvestigation.title: Investigation
isaInvestigation.description: Created using the MetaboLights Online Editor (MOE)

studies.title: Benchmarking non-targeted metabolomics using yeast extract controls
studies.description: Non-target analysis based on high resolution mass spectrometry calls for quality controls to validate analytical workflows. So far no community-wide used quality control material has been established in metabolomics. In this work, we propose ethanolic yeast extracts derived from Pichia pastoris in vivo fermentation as stable and cheap controls. The provided open-source database of ca. 200 annotated metabolites enables to benchmark the coverage of non-targeted metabolomics workflows.

publications.title: Benchmarking non-targeted metabolomics using yeast extract controls
publications.authorList: Evelyn Rampler, Gerrit Hermann, Gerlinde Grabmann, Yasin El Abiead, Harald Schoeny, Christoph Baumgartinger, Thomas Köcher, Gunda Koellensperger

protocols.name: Sample collection
protocols.description: The endogenous Pichia pastoris (Guillierm.) Phaff 1956 (Komagataella phaffii Kurtzman) boiling ethanolic extract was produced by 72h of fed-batch fermentation (ISOtopic solutions e.U., Vienna, Austria). P. pastoris was cultivated in a New Brunswick BioFlo 310 fed-batch fermentor for 38 h (Eppendorf, Hamburg, Germany) with full control over the input variables in terms of glucose as carbon source (Cambridge Isotope laboratories), pH, temperature and oxygenation. Process monitoring was facilitated by online measurement of pH, temperature, and dissolved oxygen. Offline assessment of optical density at 600 nm (OD600) and optical cell counting was performed at several time points. The cells were fermented until an OD600 of 12.

protocols.name: Extraction
protocols.description:
At the end of the fermentation process, the biomass was quenched in 60% methanol (v/v) at -30 ℃ and subsequently extracted in boiling 80% ethanol (v/v) for metabolites. Finally, the ethanolic extract was aliquoted and dried in a vacuum centrifuge (Genevac EZ2). Aliquots of the Pichia pastoris ethanolic extracts derived from ~2 billion yeast cells were dried in 15 mL tubes and stored at -80°C prior to analysis. Three different batches (2017, 2018, 2019) were analyzed. Batch 2017 and 2018 was dissolved in 2.5 mL H2O and Batch 2019 was dissolved in 5 mL H2O.


An aliquot of 100 µL was transferred into an Eppendorf tube and centrifuged at 4 °C for 10 min at 15 000 g. 50 µL of the supernatant was diluted 1:1 (v/v) with acetonitrile (ACN, HiPerSolv CHROMANORM®, VWR) or 0.1% formic acid (FA, Suprapur®, Merck), for HILIC or RP measurements, respectively. 10 μL of each diluted sample were pooled and used as a quality control (QC) sample.

protocols.name: Chromatography
protocols.description: Samples were randomly assigned into the autosampler and metabolites were separated on a SeQuant ZIC-pHILIC HPLC column (Merck, 100 x 2.1 mm; 5 µm) or a RP-column (Waters, ACQUITY UPLC HSS T3 150 x 2.1; 1.8 μm) with a flow rate of 100 µL min-1 delivered through an Ultimate 3000 HPLC system (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Germany). The stepwise gradient for HILIC analysis (adapted from Wernisch and Pennathur5) involved starting conditions of 90 % A (100 % ACN), ramp to 25% B (25 mM ammonium hydrogen carbonate for HPLC LiChropur®, Merck) within 6 min, 2 min hold at 25% B, from 8 to 21 min a ramp to 60% B was applied, switching to 80% B at 21.5 min followed by a flushing (21.5-26 min: 80% B) and reequilibration step (26.1-35 at 90% A). The gradient for RP analysis involved a linear ramp up time of 20 min starting with 99% A (0.1% formic acid) to 60% B (0.1% formic acid in ACN) followed by 5 min hold (21-26 min) at 90% B and a reequlibration step (26.1-36 min: 1% A).

protocols.name: Mass spectrometry
protocols.description: All samples were analyzed by both HILIC and RP separation followed by ESI-HRMS in polarity switching mode. Sample spectra were acquired in the mass range of 60-900 m/z by data-dependent high-resolution tandem mass spectrometry on a Q-Exactive Focus (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Germany). Ionization potential was set to +3.5/-3.0 kV, the sheeth gas flow was set to 20, and an auxiliary gas flow of 5 was used. Samples were analyzed in a randomized fashion bracketed by a blank and QC sample for background correction and normalization of the data. QC samples were additionally measured in confirmation mode to obtain further MS/MS spectra for identification.

protocols.name: Data transformation
protocols.description:
All measured RP and HILIC-HRMS raw-files have been used for Compound Discover 3.1.0.035 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) directly. For the batch samples from 2019 a scaling factor of 2 was used (as dissolved in 5 mL H2O compared to 2.5 mL for batch 2017 and 2018). Detailed description of all parameters used in the Compound discoverer workflow can be found in the metabolite identification part.


Files used

pHILIC :

List of abbreviations used for file descriptions:

QCIS- pooled Quality Control Isotopic Solutions

sw- polarity switching in MS

pos- positive polarity in MS

neg- negative polarity in MS

CS -MS Confirmation Standards for identifaction in Compound Discoverer

T1-Technical MS replicate 1

ID- for Identification only in Compound Discoverer

D- Discovery mode in MS

protocols.name: Metabolite identification
protocols.description:
Obtained data sets have been processed by compound discoverer 3.1.0.035 (Thermo Fisher Scientific).

Processing parameter are the same for data evaluation of pHILIC and RP data unless otherwise stated.

Detailed applied compound discoverer nodes and parameters:

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 1: Input Files

------------------------------------------------------------------

Input Data: pHILIC

- File Name(s) (Hidden):

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_QCIS_ID_sw_pHILIC_yeast_T1.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_QCIS_ID_sw_pHILIC_yeast_T2.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_QCIS_ID_sw_pHILIC_yeast_T3.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_QCIS_ID_sw_pHILIC_yeast_T4.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_sample_D_sw_pHILIC_yeast_B2018_0083_T1.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_sample_D_sw_pHILIC_yeast_B2018_0053_T1.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_sample_D_sw_pHILIC_yeast_B2017_0064_T1.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_blank_D_sw_pHILIC_50pACN_T3.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\2020-04-29\20200429_QCIS_D_sw_pHILIC_yeast_T3.raw

 

Input Data: RP

File Name(s) (Hidden):

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\20200428\20200428_blank_D_pos_RP_p1FA_T3.raw

               E:\2020 files\2020-04\20200428\20200428_QCIS_D_sw_RP_yeast_T3.raw

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 3: Select Spectra

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Precursor Selection: Use MS(n - 1) Precursor

- Use Isotope Pattern in Precursor Reevaluation: True

- Provide Profile Spectra: Automatic

- Store Chromatograms: False

 

2. Spectrum Properties Filter:

- Lower RT Limit: 0

- Upper RT Limit: 0

- First Scan: 0

- Last Scan: 0

- Ignore Specified Scans: (not specified)

- Lowest Charge State: 0

- Highest Charge State: 0

- Min. Precursor Mass: 70 Da

- Max. Precursor Mass: 1100 Da

- Total Intensity Threshold: 0

- Minimum Peak Count: 1

 

3. Scan Event Filters:

- Mass Analyzer: Any

- MS Order: Any

- Activation Type: Any

- Min. Collision Energy: 0

- Max. Collision Energy: 1000

- Scan Type: Any

- Polarity Mode: (not specified)

 

4. Peak Filters:

- S/N Threshold (FT-only): 1.5

 

5. Replacements for Unrecognized Properties:

- Unrecognized Charge Replacements: 1

- Unrecognized Mass Analyzer Replacements: FTMS

- Unrecognized MS Order Replacements: MS2

- Unrecognized Activation Type Replacements: HCD

- Unrecognized Polarity Replacements: +

- Unrecognized MS Resolution@200 Replacements: 60000

- Unrecognized MSn Resolution@200 Replacements: 30000

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 40: Align Retention Times

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Alignment Model: Adaptive curve

- Alignment Fallback: Use Linear Model

- Maximum Shift [min]: 0.5

- Shift Reference File: True

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- Remove Outlier: True

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 8: Detect Compounds

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Mass Tolerance [ppm]: 5 ppm

- Intensity Tolerance [%]: 30

- S/N Threshold: 3

- Min. Peak Intensity: 100000

- Ions: [M+H]+1; [M-H]-1

- Base Ions: [M+H]+1; [M-H]-1

- Min. Element Counts: C H

- Max. Element Counts: C90 H190 Br3 Cl4 K2 N10 Na2 O18 P5 S5

 

2. Peak Detection:

- Filter Peaks: True

- Max. Peak Width [min]: 1

- Remove Singlets: True

- Min. Scans per Peak: 6

- Min. Isotopes: 2

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 6: Group Compounds

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Compound Consolidation:

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- RT Tolerance [min]: 0.5

 

2. Fragment Data Selection:

- Preferred Ions: [M+H]+1; [M-H]-1

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 9: Fill Gaps

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- S/N Threshold: 1.5

- Use Real Peak Detection: True

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 39: Normalize Areas

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. QC-based Area Correction:

- Regression Model: Linear

- Min. QC Coverage [%]: 50

- Max. QC Area RSD [%]: 30

- Max. Files Between QC Files: 15

 

 

2. Area Normalization:

- Normalization Type: Scaling Factor

- Exclude Blanks: True

 

3. Scaling Factor:

- Study Factor Name: normalization

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 13: Mark Background Compounds

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Max. Sample/Blank: 10

- Max. Blank/Sample: 0

- Hide Background: True

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 19: Assign Compound Annotations

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

 

2. Data Sources:

- Data Source 1: MassList Search

- Data Source 2: mzVault Search

- Data Source 3: Predicted Compositions

- Data Source 4: (not specified)

- Data Source 5: (not specified)

- Data Source 6: (not specified)

- Data Source 7: (not specified)

 

3. Scoring Rules:

- Use mzLogic: False

- Use Spectral Distance: False

- SFit Threshold: 20

- SFit Range: 20

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 33: Search mzVault

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Search Settings:

- mzVault Library pHILIC: mzVault_pos_pHILIC.db|mzVault_VBCF_pHILIC_neg_edit1.db

- mzVault Library RP: mzVault_RP_new_20190403.db|mzVault_RP_neg.db

- Max. Results: 10

- Match Factor Threshold: 50

- Search Algorithm: HighChem HighRes

- Match Analyzer Type: True

- IT Fragment Mass Tolerance: 0.4 Da

- FT Fragment Mass Tolerance: 10 ppm

- Use Retention Time: False

- Precursor Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- Apply Intensity Threshold: True

- Match Ionization Method: True

- Ion Activation Energy Tolerance: 20

- Match Ion Activation Energy: Any

- Match Ion Activation Type: True

- Compound Classes: All

- Remove Precursor Ion: False

- RT Tolerance [min]: 2

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 30: Search Mass Lists

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Search Settings:

- Mass Lists pHILIC:     MassList_VBCF_pHILIC_25mM_ABC_neg.massList|MassList_VBCF_pHILIC_25mM_ABC_pos.massList

- Mass Lists RP: MassList_VBCF_waters_60-90_RP_neg.massList|MassList_VBCF_RP_waters_60-90.massList

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- Use Retention Time: True

- RT Tolerance [min]: 0.4

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 16: Predict Compositions

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Prediction Settings:

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- Min. Element Counts: C H

- Max. Element Counts: C90 H190 Br3 Cl4 N10 O18 P5 S5

- Min. RDBE: 0

- Max. RDBE: 40

- Min. H/C: 0.1

- Max. H/C: 3.5

- Max. Candidates: 10

- Max. Internal Candidates: 200

 

2. Pattern Matching:

- Intensity Tolerance [%]: 30

- Intensity Threshold [%]: 0.1

- S/N Threshold: 3

- Min. Spectral Fit [%]: 30

- Min. Pattern Cov. [%]: 90

- Use Dynamic Recalibration: True

 

3. Fragments Matching:

- Use Fragments Matching: True

- Mass Tolerance: 5 ppm

- S/N Threshold: 3

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 23: Create Analog Trace

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Trace Type: UV

- RT Offset [min]: 0

- Custom Label: (not specified)

 

2. PDA Settings:

- Total Scan: False

- Spectrum Maximum: False

- Wavelength Range: True

- Min. Wavelength: 190

- Max. Wavelength: 800

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 17: Descriptive Statistics

------------------------------------------------------------------

No parameters

------------------------------------------------------------------

Processing node 18: Differential Analysis

------------------------------------------------------------------

1. General Settings:

- Log10 Transform Values: True

 


Additionally, compounds were annotated through comparing the retention time against our internal mass list database which was generated with authentic standard solutions. A retention time window of 0.4 min and a mass accuracy of 5 ppm for precursor masses was set. In addition, MS2 spectra were compared against our internal MS/MS database taking 10 ppm for fragment ion masses into account as well.

assays.technologyPlatform: Liquid Chromatography MS - alternating - reverse phase
